title: 2017–18 Hallyburton Johnstone Shield
text:
The 2017–18 Hallyburton Johnstone Shield was a <a href="List%20A%20cricket">50-over</a> women's cricket competition that took place in New Zealand. This was the first time a tournament had been named the <a href="Hallyburton%20Johnstone%20Shield">Hallyburton Johnstone Shield</a> since 1981–82, which was previously predominately a <a href="First-class%20cricket">first-class</a> competition. It ran from November 2017 to January 2018, with 6 provincial teams taking part. <a href="Auckland%20Hearts">Auckland Hearts</a> topped the group with 8 wins to win the competition.
The tournament ran alongside the <a href="2017%E2%80%9318%20New%20Zealand%20Women%27s%20Twenty20%20Competition">2017–18 New Zealand Women's Twenty20 Competition</a>.
Competition format.
Teams played in a <a href="round-robin%20tournament">double round-robin</a> in a group of six, therefore playing 10 matches overall. Matches were played using a <a href="limited%20overs%20cricket">one day</a> format with 50 overs per side. The team that topped the group were named the Champions.
The group worked on a points system with positions being based on the total points. Points were awarded as follows:
Win: 4 points 
<a href="Result%20%28cricket%29%23Tie">Tie</a>: 2 points 
Loss: 0 points.
Abandoned/No Result: 2 points.
Bonus Point: 1 point awarded for run rate in a match being 1.25x that of opponent.
